quoteFirst: During May our time is slow, the sun coming to the meridian about three minutes before noon, as indicated by our clocks. Sunrise occurs at 4:58, 4:42, and
quoteLast: , on the 1st, 16th, and 30th, respectively, while sunset is at 6:55, 7:10, and 7:22 p. m. on the corresponding days. Day breaks on the 16th at 2:43 a. m., and twilight ends at 9:09 p. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, May 1885, No. 8
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteLast: Fired on two targets on orders from O.P.
title: Pushed and the Return Push
author: Nichols, George Herbert Fosdike

quoteFirst: On the 1st March there was a demonstration at 5 p.m., which consisted of artillery and infantry fire and cheering as if for an attack. The following morning at
quoteLast: the 3rd Division attacked and captured International and New Year trenches and "The Bean" with over 200 prisoners. On the 18th March, the Battalion was relieved and moved to Poperinghe by train from Ypres.
title: The story of the 6th Battalion, the Durham Light Infantry
author: Ainsworth, Ralph Bignell, Sir, 1875-1952 [Editor]

quoteFirst: “The early bird obtains worms,” she say cheerly when I arise at
title: Mr. Togo: Maid of all Work
